snippet: Intentional draws to maintain a share of the prize are a scourge of tournaments, but others must compete for first.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column observes that intentional draws to guarantee that each player gets a share of the prize money are a scourge of tournaments.
lead_paragraph: Intentional draws to maintain a share of the prize are a scourge of tournaments, but others must compete for first.

headline.print_headline: Grandmaster Draws Persist, but So Do Fights to the End
headline.seo: Grandmaster Draws Persist, but So Do Fights to the Finish
headline.main: Grandmaster Draws Persist, but So Do Fights to the End
